Getting started with pack_install Package

This project aims at identifing the installed and uninstalled packages

Following is the function that we have developed in Python

  • Check packages are installed or not

Find installed and uninstalled pcakages

In this function we take one input parameter, a list of package names which we want to check are installed or not. The data type can be only list. Input list should not be empty.

Code to find the installed and uninstalled packages.
 1def package_installation_status(lst):
 2if type(lst) == list:                                            # Check if input parameter is list or not.
 3    if len(lst) != 0:                                            # Check if list is empty or not
 4        installed_package_list = []
 5        unistalled_package_list = []
 6        for name in lst:
 7            spec = importlib.util.find_spec(name)
 8            if spec is None:
 9                unistalled_package_list.append(name)
10            else:
11                installed_package_list.append(name)
12        package_info = {
13            "installed_packages": installed_package_list,         # Creating the list of installed packages.
14            "not_installed_packages": unistalled_package_list,    # Creating the list of uninstalled packages.
15        }
16        return package_info
17    else:
18        raise ValueError("The list is empty")                     # Value Error will be raised if list is empty.
19else:
20    raise TypeError("Please provide list input")                  # Type Error will be raised if datatype is not list.

From the code block we see that this code takes necessary input parameter, a list of package names and returns a dictonery containing two lists of installed ans not installed packages.

Examples

Below are some examples of running the code with different inputs.

  • When some of the given packages are installed and some not

NO ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status(["numpy","pandas","matplotlib","tensorflow"]))
2{'installed_packages': ['numpy', 'pandas'], 'not_installed_packages': ['matplotlib', 'tensorflow']}

  • When all the given packages are installed

NO ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status(["numpy","pandas"]))
2{'installed_packages': ['numpy', 'pandas'], 'not_installed_packages': []}

  • When all the given packages are not installed

NO ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status(["matplotlib","tensorflow"]))
2{'installed_packages': [], 'not_installed_packages': ['matplotlib', 'tensorflow']}

  • When input list is empty:

ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status([]))
2Traceback (most recent call last):
3    File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
4    File "<stdin>", line 18, in package_installation_status
5ValueError: The list is empty

  • When input Parameter is other than list:

ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status("pandas"))
2Traceback (most recent call last):
3    File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
4    File "<stdin>", line 20, in package_installation_status
5TypeError: Please provide list as input

  • When no input is given:

ERROR
1>>> print(package_installation_status())
2    Traceback (most recent call last):
3    TypeError: package_installation_status()
4missing 1 required positional argument: 'lst'
